data.question: What is the purpose of using a square planar palladium(II) template in the synthesis described?
data.answer: The square planar palladium(II) template is used to direct the synthesis of a [2]catenate, along with two isomers of the interlocked structure.

data.question: What yield is obtained when cyclizing the monodentate unit prior to attaching both ligands to the metal?
data.answer: 78% yield

data.question: Is the [2]catenate formed when preforming the tridentate macrocycle?
data.answer: Yes, preforming the tridentate macrocycle produces a complex in two atropisomeric forms, one of which generates the [2]catenate upon RCM.

data.question: Can the threaded and nonthreaded atropisomers interconvert in dichloromethane at room temperature?
data.answer: No, the threaded and nonthreaded atropisomers do not interconvert in dichloromethane at room temperature over 7 days.

data.question: What method is used to confirm the structure of the complexes?
data.answer: X-ray crystallography

data.question: What is the effect of heating the acyclic atropisomers in acetonitrile?
data.answer: Heating the acyclic atropisomers in acetonitrile provides a mechanism for their interconversion via ligand exchange.

data.question: Is the [2]catenate the only product formed when preforming the monodentate macrocycle?
data.answer: False, preforming the monodentate macrocycle and applying metal-directed cyclization of the tridentate ligand also affords exclusively the [2]catenate.

data.question: What is the yield of the single large macrocycle when olefin metathesis of both building blocks is performed while they are attached to the metal?
data.answer: 77% yield

data.question: Does the presence of acetonitrile affect the threaded:nonthreaded ratio of atropisomers?
data.answer: Yes, the addition of acetonitrile leads to a gradual change in the threaded:nonthreaded ratio, indicating that atropisomer interconversion can take place.

data.question: Are the atropisomers kinetically stable at room temperature in a noncoordinating solvent?
data.answer: True, the atropisomers are kinetically stable at room temperature in a noncoordinating solvent.

data.question: What technique confirms the molecular weight of the complexes?
data.answer: FAB mass spectrometry

data.question: Is the orthogonal alignment of organic fragments achieved using a '3 + 1' donor set of ligands?
data.answer: True, the orthogonal alignment of organic fragments is achieved using a '3 + 1' donor set of ligands.

data.question: What is the outcome of the synthetic pathway determined by?
data.answer: The order in which the tridentate and monodentate ligand cyclization reactions and coordination steps are performed determines the outcome of the synthetic pathway.

data.question: What is the yield of the [2]catenate when the monodentate macrocycle is preformed?
data.answer: 78% yield

data.question: Can the choice of solvent determine whether the [2]catenate or its noninterlocked isomer is formed?
data.answer: True, the choice of solvent can determine whether the [2]catenate is formed or its noninterlocked isomer.

data.question: What is the role of potassium cyanide in the synthesis?
data.answer: Potassium cyanide is used to demetalate the complexes, liberating the organic macrocycles.

data.question: Is the [2]catenate the only product formed when the tridentate macrocycle is preformed?
data.answer: False, preforming the tridentate macrocycle followed by its coordination along with the acyclic monodentate ligand to the Pd produces threaded and nonthreaded atropisomers.

data.question: What is the yield of the single large macrocycle when cyclizing the monodentate unit prior to attaching both ligands to the metal?
data.answer: 77% yield

data.question: Does the synthesis of a [2]catenate using a square planar palladium(II) template involve metal-directed macrocyclization reactions?
data.answer: True, the synthesis of a [2]catenate using a square planar palladium(II) template involves metal-directed macrocyclization reactions.

data.question: What determines the formation of the three isomers in the synthesis?
data.answer: The sequence that the rings were cyclized and whether or not the building blocks were attached to the metal prior to macrocyclization determines the formation of the three isomers.
